title: Social Entrepreneurship and Tekstilnica Municipality Dravograd
segmentation: My name is Sebastian Pekar.
Thank you for the invitation.
I will quickly, quickly really quickly present our social initiative.
Social enter preneurship or social Enterprise initiative 60 minutes, which is dealing with collecting textile, old textile garments and clothes and recycling it to serve another purpose.
So so the textile has 1, two or three or more lives before it is at the end, destroy.
As I said it, extremely.

Some is a normative approach towards collection, sorting and reuse, and recycling goes old clothes and it began as a project in 2010 with five partners and later on it actually developed in two partner Project which was supported by the Ministry of Labor and Social Affairs through the European Social Fund and at this time actually it runs a warehouse in.
A region called Carinthia and in and the project employs 5 individuals.
Four of them are from so-called harder employable group.
That means individuals over 55 or those who are searching for their employment for the first time.
Dumb.
And this point, actually, in 2012 it succeeded to collect around 100 tons of textiles and and recycle it.
So this is a broad and quick presentation and.
Oh
First part, and now I'll go a little bit into the process of collecting.
How is it done so in the first phase, the project actually relied on the collection through so called.
I talk collecting actions through household collection and collections through schools.
So we organized collection actions in schools and.
Households, but in order to.
To get towards the more let's say.
Constant income of the of the textile and garments we decided to establish a overall Slovenian collection in so-called containers.
Textile bins, which we're trying now to install.
Firstly in the region, Carinthia, and then all over the all over the region all over the Slovenia.
So few basic basic, let's say data on textile.
Actually.
Imports to Slovenia of textile around 10 and garments are around 10 kilograms per year.
That means are approximately 20,000 tons and waste from home textile.
Actually prior is around 14,000 tons, and if we, as I said before, if we were able to collect around 100 tons last last year so you can see what is the potential of this of this.
Initiative.
Actually, what we do with this textile is we.
In the in the warehouse where we collect them.
After we collected the textile, what we do is sort it.
So we sort it on different segments.
And here is let's say a basic basic statistics on on the segments we how we actually reuse or recycle what we collect and around 5% at this time is reused.
This is the best.
Let's say the best or so.
It is called FirstClass textile which is which can still be worn.
And he sold to secondhand textile shops, then around 10% of it is transforming to the so called industrial racks, which industrial industry uses for different different.
Sorts of cleaning.
So for cleaning.
Oil or or water or whatever and then around 9 to 10% is used for new products.
We will later on show you these products which these people who are employed in the in the.
In our warehouse, what did they do out of it?
And I don't 5% is donated to charity, but still what we would like to change is that 17% of it of collecting textiles at this point is still exported and sold in the international market.
This is in one sense textile industry.
Secondhand textile industry is a global, really global industry.
Actually, around 3 billion.
Dollars worth 3 billion dollars and it's around 1.2 or at this time.
I think that close to 2 million tons of textile is shipped here and there, but.
What we would like to do in later stages is to develop, develop a way or process which would actually be able to recycle most of the textile here in Slovenia for different for different purposes.
And this is our mission later on.
So you can see here.
This is our warehousing drowned rat.
You can see the left down picture.
Is is collecting textile in plastic bags and then segment which is already sorted.
And here are.
Some.
Our unique items we produce.
Handbags, shopping bags, slippers, all are unique because there is usually only enough material only to make one item out.
And then different, let's say.
Handbags for medicines and jewelry, floral pots and so.
Back rollers for seating.
And this is our, let's say, one of the best missing the major biggest items is bean bags, which are mostly.
Most of it is made out of the recycling material.
Even the feeling can be actually made out of the recycling material.
So if it's cut to the small pieces, actually only only, let's say zippers are are new and everything else can be.
Coming out of the new and these are these industrial racks wipers for for industry.
And as I said, over our vision is to establish a collection all over Slovenia in next 2 years open fuel franchise secondhand stores, and actually make our own designer line, which let's.
Freelance young freelance designers to expand our range of products.

And at the end establish effective international marketing and we're trying to organize the this cooperative as a social enterprise social business, and we're slowly including our workers into the process of deciding how how the company should be run and which.
Which goals it should follow?
We are a part of social entrepreneurship forum of Slovenia and Forum is kind of.
Umbrella organization for social entrepreneurship, which has its mission to establish itself as a.
Supporting environment to offer help and international cooperation to the social, business, social, economy, sector and currently it.
Its membership is around 150 individuals and legal entities and we hope actually to develop, develop it further in next 2 years.

And let's say one of the basic or or let's say most important legal entities in Slovenia for the social enterprises we see cooperatives, we think that cooperatives are away to go away from something which needs to be rediscovered in redeveloping Slovenia in order to boost boost the sector of social economy.
And this is what we are following.
Thank you for your attention.
